intro: Ophrys × panepintoi, commonly known as the hybrid bee orchid, is a fascinating plant that results from the natural cross between Ophrys apifera and Ophrys insectifera. It is characterized by its intricate floral structure, which mimics the appearance of female bees to attract male pollinators. The plant is native to the Balkan Peninsula, where it thrives in calcareous soils and open habitats. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to brownish in color, with intricate patterns that enhance its mimicry. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
